snippet: The settlement followed a whistle-blower lawsuit that asserted the company had induced physicians to use its devices by paying them inflated fees.
abstract: Heart implants maker Biotronik agrees to pay $4.9 million to resolve Justice Department claims that it paid kickbacks to physicians to use its devices; settlement follows whistle-blower lawsuit filed by former Biotronik employee Brian Sant.
lead_paragraph: The settlement followed a whistle-blower lawsuit that asserted the company had induced physicians to use its devices by paying them inflated fees.

headline.main: Biotronik to Pay $4.9 Million to Settle Kickback Claims
headline.print_headline: Biotronik to Pay $4.9. Million to Settle Kickback Claims
